name: Pet Data
title: Pet Data

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the heart of the PetData API, offering a seamless way to retrieve essential information. When you send a request to this endpoint with specific query parameters, it provides a response in the form of an array of objects. These objects represent individual rows of data associated with your query. Imagine you need to access various details about pets available for adoption in your area. By making a simple request to the 'records' endpoint, you will receive an array filled with information such as pet breeds, ages, sizes, and more. Each object within the array serves as a comprehensive snapshot of a particular pet's characteristics.This invaluable feature enables users to effortlessly interact with the PetData API and retrieve tailored results based on their requirements. With the 'records' endpoint, you can quickly gather the data you need without having to navigate complex technicalities. It simplifies the process of finding pets for adoption, providing a user-friendly and intuitive experience.

api_list.name: /inDate
api_list.description: The 'inDate' endpoint in the PetData API provides a user-friendly way to access an array of strings containing possible values for the 'inDate' field. This field represents the date when a pet's information was recorded or updated. By calling this endpoint, you can obtain a list of various dates on which pet data was created or modified.The 'inDate' values returned by this endpoint may include dates from the past or the future. Each date string follows the format of MM/DD/YYYY, representing the month, day, and year of a specific occurrence.By utilizing this endpoint, you can leverage the range of 'inDate' values to filter or sort pet data based on the dates they were recorded or modified. This feature can be particularly useful when analyzing trends, searching for pet updates within a specific time frame, or organizing data chronologically.Using the 'inDate' endpoint, you can effectively retrieve an array of available dates associated with pet information, enabling you to access and manipulate the data based on various time references.

api_list.name: /urlLink
api_list.description: The 'urlLink' endpoint in the PetData API provides an array of strings containing the possible values for the 'urlLink' field. This field represents the URLs that lead to images of pets available for adoption. Each URL link corresponds to a specific pet's image and can be accessed by clicking the link. The 'urlLink' endpoint allows users to fetch all the available URLs for these pet images.These URLs are structured similar to the examples provided: http://www.petharbor.com/get_image.asp?res=DETAIL&id=[PET_ID]&location=[LOCATION]. Just replace [PET_ID] with the unique identification code of the pet and [LOCATION] with the corresponding location. The 'urlLink' endpoint provides a handy way to retrieve all these possible URLs, enabling users to easily browse and view images of pets that are currently up for adoption.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint of the 'PetData' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve an array of strings containing various possible values for the 'dataListIndex' field. This field represents a unique identifier or index associated with specific data lists within the API. By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list of available 'dataListIndex' values, which can be useful for understanding the different categories or classifications of data available.For instance, if you are building a pet-related application, the 'dataListIndex' values could represent various types of pets such as dogs, cats, birds, or fish. This endpoint allows you to dynamically fetch all the possible 'dataListIndex' values, enabling you to present an extensive selection of pet categories to your users. By utilizing this endpoint, you can ensure that your application stays updated with the latest values and provides accurate information to users.To summarize, the 'dataListIndex' endpoint provides an array of strings encompassing all the possible values for the 'dataListIndex' field. This allows developers to seamlessly integrate and leverage the API's broad range of data categories in a user-friendly manner.

api_list.name: /breed
api_list.description: The 'breed' endpoint from the PetData API is a useful resource for obtaining a comprehensive list of different breeds for pets. When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings containing all the possible values for the 'breed' field. This endpoint provides valuable information for pet owners, animal enthusiasts, or those in the pet industry who need to access specific breed names for various animals.By querying the 'breed' endpoint, you can obtain a wealth of diverse information about pet breeds, ranging from popular breeds like dogs, cats, or birds, to more niche or exotic breeds. The returned array of strings will include the names of these breeds, and you can manipulate this data to suit different purposes. It can be utilized to create dropdown lists on websites or apps, validate user input, classify animals, or even generate random breed selections. Overall, the 'breed' endpoint is an essential tool for anyone dealing with pet-related data, offering a convenient and organized way to access and work with a wide range of pet breeds.

api_list.name: /animalType
api_list.description: The 'animalType' endpoint in the PetData API provides a convenient way to retrieve all the available categories or types of animals that the database supports. Upon accessing this endpoint, a collection of strings is returned, which represents the various animal types. These types could include common categories such as 'cat' and 'dog', but could also encompass more unique or specific categories like 'other' to represent animals that do not fall into conventional categories. The endpoint offers valuable information about the diversity of animals stored within the database, enabling users to understand and distinguish between different types of animals easily. By utilizing this endpoint, developers can efficiently integrate the necessary data regarding animal types into their applications or systems.

api_list.name: /crossing
api_list.description: The 'crossing' endpoint in the PetData API provides a helpful array of strings that represents the various possible values for the field 'crossing'. This endpoint is designed to assist users in accessing a comprehensive list of crossing options available for pets. For instance, if you are searching for information related to animal breeds, this endpoint will provide you with a range of crossbreeds, hybrid varieties, or mixed breeds.By utilizing this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of strings that includes all the different crossing options available within the PetData API. This feature greatly simplifies the process of gathering comprehensive information about the various crossing possibilities for pets. Whether you are an animal enthusiast, a pet owner, or someone working in the pet industry, this endpoint serves as a valuable resource for identifying and researching different crossbreeds and mixed-breed options.

api_list.name: /animalId
api_list.description: The 'animalId' endpoint in the PetData API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve an array of strings containing various identification values for different animals. Each 'animalId' represents a unique identifier assigned to a specific animal within the PetData system. These identifiers are typically alphanumeric and can include letters, numbers, or a combination of both.By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain a comprehensive list of all the possible 'animalId' values available in the PetData database. This information could be useful for users who are looking for specific animals or need to filter and search for data based on animal identification.Please note that the actual 'animalId' values returned by the API would differ from the examples given (A501294, A501998, A505098). The endpoint serves as a resource to explore and understand the range of animal identification codes stored in the PetData system.

api_list.name: /petName
api_list.description: The 'petName' endpoint from the 'PetData' API provides valuable information about the names that can be given to pets. When you interact with this endpoint, it retrieves an array of strings representing various possible pet names. These names are not limited to any specific type of pet and encompass a wide range of options.Pets hold a special place in our lives, and finding the perfect name for them is essential. This endpoint serves as a repository where you can explore an extensive list of potential names for your beloved furry companions. Whether you are looking for a playful name like 'Biscuit' or a regal one like 'Kingston,' the 'petName' endpoint has got you covered.By utilizing this endpoint, you can access creative and distinctive names to match the unique personality of your pet. It offers an opportunity to discover naming ideas that may not have crossed your mind and ensures you select a name that clicks perfectly with your adorable companion.Note: The examples provided above, such as 'BOB' and 'SILVER CHIEF,' are not actual names that would be returned by the endpoint. They are only mentioned for the purpose of explanation.

api_list.name: /petSize
api_list.description: The 'petSize' endpoint from the 'PetData' API provides a list of all possible values for the size of pets. Size is an important characteristic when considering a pet, as it pertains to their physical dimensions. This endpoint returns an array of strings representing different pet sizes. By accessing this endpoint, you can discover the various sizes available, which can range from small to medium to large. The 'petSize' endpoint is useful for users who want to filter or search for pets based on their preferred size. For example, if someone is looking for a small pet, they can utilize this endpoint to retrieve the possible values for small-sized pets. This user-friendly API endpoint simplifies the process of finding pets that match specific size requirements, helping individuals make informed decisions when adopting a pet.

api_list.name: /sex
api_list.description: The 'sex' endpoint in the PetData API provides a range of values that represent the gender or sex of a pet. This endpoint returns an array of strings, where each string represents a possible value for the 'sex' field. These values can help categorize pets into male, female, or other non-binary options.By using this endpoint, you can easily retrieve the various options available for specifying the sex of a pet within the PetData system. This information can be useful for creating filters or search functionalities based on pet sex or for statistical analysis.The values provided by this endpoint may include options such as 'Male' for male pets, 'Female' for female pets, and potentially other options like 'Unknown' or 'Not Specified' for cases where the sex is not known or intentionally undisclosed.Using the 'sex' endpoint in the PetData API allows you to efficiently access and work with the sex-related data of pets, helping you manage and understand the gender distribution within the pet population.

api_list.name: /intakeType
api_list.description: The 'intakeType' endpoint of the PetData API provides a user-friendly way to access various options related to the type of intake for pets. Each intake type represents a specific or reason for a pet's arrival or admission to a particular facility or organization. By calling this endpoint, can retrieve an array of strings that lists all the possible values for the 'intakeType' field.These values can include options such as 'Owner Surrender' which indicates that the pet has been voluntarily given up by its owner, or 'Return Owner Surrender' which suggests that the pet was previously surrendered by its owner but has now been returned. There may be various other intake types depending on the specific system or organization using the PetData API.By understanding the available intake types through this endpoint, users can process and categorize pet intake data more efficiently. It facilitates easy identification of the circumstances under which pets are received, helping in tracking trends, analyzing patterns, and implementing appropriate actions for each intake type accordingly.

api_list.name: /color
api_list.description: Thecolor' endpoint of the 'Data' API provides a-friendly way access a wide range of colors can be associated with pets When you make a request this endpoint, it will return array of strings containing all possible values for the '' field. Colors play an role in identifying and describing, and this endpoint helps you the different color options that exist.For example imagine you want to know the various colors in which pets are available. By using this endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list without needing to search through different sources. The array of strings may include colors like black, brown, white, or even more unique shades like gray, orange, or spotted patterns. This information can be helpful for pet owners, breeders, or anyone interested in understanding the diversity of colors within the pet population.By leveraging the 'color' endpoint in the 'PetData' API, you can easily retrieve a valuable collection of potential pet colors, aiding in various pet-related scenarios like pet adoption, breed analysis, or simply satisfying curiosity about the wide array of colors that pets come in.

api_list.name: /petAge
api_list.description: The 'petAge' endpoint from the 'PetData' API provides a comprehensive list of all the possible age values for pets. The endpoint returns an array of strings that represent different age values for pets. These age values can be expressed in various formats, such as months or years, to cover a broad range of pets' ages.Using this endpoint, developers can retrieve all the available age options for pets, which can be helpful in creating drop-down lists, filtering data, or validating user input. The returned array consists of strings that represent the age of a pet, containing both numerical values and units of time such as months or years.By utilizing the 'petAge' endpoint, applications can ensure accurate and standardized data entry for pet ages, enhancing the user experience and enabling efficient categorization and analysis of pet-related information.
